strings.Value: "Where are you from?"
"Who are all those people on the bridge?"
"I have to go."
"I found the berries you were talking about."
"I found your berries. You lied. These aren't medicine — they're poison."
[Give him the berries] "If that's really what you want..."
"My goal was to help you, not kill you. You'll have to find some other way to end your life if that's what you want."
"Find Jhod Kavken in town. He can identify your illness and give you the help you need."
"Why are you so sure you have the same illness?"
[Attack] "First you fool me, and now you dare beg me for yet more help? Perhaps you've found your death after all!"
[Attack] "I am the {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}. And you're about to learn how I deal with any rabble who would dare vilify me!"
"You shouldn't speak of the {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen} that way."
{n}The old man who called to you looks to be in bad shape: pale face, dark circles under his eyes, and his forehead glistening with sweat. There's no doubt this man is very sick.{/n}

"Hey... hey, {mf|lad|lass}! Would you-" {n}The old man breaks into a coughing fit.{/n} "Would you do an old man a favor in his hour of need? I've traveled far, but I somehow fell ill along the way. I know of a berry that grows along the coast in these parts, though — it's supposed to be a potent medicine. It will-" {n}The old man coughs again.{/n} "It'll put anyone back on their feet!"

"They're black — hard to miss..." {n}The old man bursts into more coughing for a few moments.{/n} "Black with a hint of purple. The bush is short. You've strong legs and sharp eyes. Honor-" {n}The old man coughs again but quickly controls it.{/n} "Honor an old man's wish — bring me a handful of those berries."
{n}The old man looks at you, hope in his purblind eyes.{/n}

"The outskirts of the {g|Narlmarches}Narlmarches{/g}. Used to live there with my son and his wife. But when this scourge started to spread through the {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom} and a few people in our village started falling ill, we knew it was time to run. Hated to abandon the house, but what could we do? My son's little ones-" {n}The old man lets out a few wet coughs.{/n} "We couldn't just let the little ones perish in that cursed place..."

"Refugees, running from an illness that causes horrible beasts to burst out of people's bodies. The rulers couldn't care less for the simple folk," {n}the old man says, cringing slightly,{/n} "so people run as far as they can. The {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen} can stay in {mf|his|her} cursed land all {mf|he|she} wants, but we want to be safe."

{n}The old man shifts his gaze down.{/n} "Please don't be angry... Look, I'm sick like all the others. I've seen the monsters come out of people — I'd rather take my own life than wait for such a terrible end!"

{n}The old man carefully examines the berries, then nods fervently.{/n} "Yes... Yes, these are the right ones. Thank you, {mf|lad|lass}." {n}He crams the black berries into his mouth and chews vigorously.{/n}

{n}A weak smile flickers across the old man's timeworn face.{/n} "And so it begins..." {n}He turns his gaze to you, his eyes going glassy.{/n} "I'm sorry, my friend, but I tricked you. I don't-" {n}The old man coughs, but it's less powerful than before.{/n} "I don't want to die to this damn sickness, let some disgusting beast crawl from my body... It's... better this way..."
"I'm... not sure. And who's to say? But waiting to see whether some horrible creature hatches out of me... I'd rather die by my own hand!"

{n}The old man carefully examines the berries, then nods fervently.{/n} "Yes... just what I needed..." {n}He raises his tearful eyes to you.{/n} "Thank you, my friend. You've saved my soul... {g|Erastil}Erastil{/g} bless you." {n}He crams the black berries into his mouth and chews vigorously.{/n}
{n}The old man's eyes swell with tears.{/n} "I beg of you, give me the berries! Let me decide my own fate!"

{n}The old man's eyes light up.{/n} "Someone... someone could help me?" {n}A weak smile crosses his wrinkled face.{/n} "There's still hope? Oh, {g|Erastil}Erastil{/g} protect this {mf|man|woman}! Thank you! Thank you! I'm leaving right now — I won't let this sickness stop me. As long as my legs will carry me, I'll make it there!"

"I left too — they're my family, after all..." {n}The old man coughs a few times.{/n} "But I'm not as strong as I once was. I started lagging behind, holding them back. So I said, 'Listen, son, save your wife and kids. I'll make it there on my own.'" {n}He coughs again, then goes silent for a moment.{/n} "We agreed to meet up in Drember village..." {n}He trails off as his eyes grow watery.{/n}
{n}The old man tries to say something else, but his lips are sluggishl, his voice silent. Berry-tinted foam drips from his mouth as his eyes roll up and he slowly sags to the ground.{/n}
"I beg you, {mf|lad|lass} — give me the berries. This is no sin upon your soul. I'd have killed myself anyway — you only helped an old man ease his suffering!"
{n}The old man waves his hand dismissively.{/n} "I'm old. I've little concern for them high lords... I just hope I don't die and none of my kin get sick!"
